article_text:
How many millions of taxpayer dollars does it take to create a new cooking oil? Government-backed Solazyme is among the companies working to provide the answer. After gorging on federal grants to make fuels that car drivers don’t want, alternative-energy companies are now trying to feed their creations to American consumers. Bon appetit!

The Journal reports that Solazyme, which in 2009 received more than $20 million in grants to build a refinery for automotive fuel, is now selling an algae-derived oil for cooking. Readers...

twitter.description: Green fuel grantees fail with biofuels but look out, Top Chef, the Wall Street Journal writes in an editorial.
twitter.title: Subsidies for Cooking Oil

og.title: Subsidies for Cooking Oil

article_summary:
How many millions of taxpayer dollars does it take to create a new cooking oil?
The Journal reports that Solazyme, which in 2009 received more than $20 million in grants to build a refinery for automotive fuel, is now selling an algae-derived oil for cooking.
Government-backed Solazyme is among the companies working to provide the answer.
After gorging on federal grants to make fuels that car drivers don’t want, alternative-energy companies are now trying to feed their creations to American consumers.
Bon appetit!
